meanings.definition: The state or quality of being two in number.
meanings.sent1: The twonesses of the twins made them easily recognizable.
meanings.sent2: I counted the twonesses of the pair of socks.
meanings.sent3: The twonesses of the two peas in a pod always caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: The twonesses of the moon phases fascinated the young astronomer.
meanings.sent5: The twonesses of the dice made it a perfect game for two players.

meanings.definition: The concept of duality or dual nature.
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting captured the twonesses of light and dark beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher often pondered the twonesses of good and evil.
meanings.sent3: The twonesses of the joker's personality always kept his friends guessing.
meanings.sent4: The twonesses of the river symbolized the constant flow of time.
meanings.sent5: The twonesses of the coin represented the choices we make in life.
